CodeGen_C.h
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #ifndef HALIDE_CODEGEN_C_H
2 #define HALIDE_CODEGEN_C_H
3 
4 /** \file
5  *
6  * Defines an IRPrinter that emits C++ code equivalent to a halide stmt
7  */
8 
9 #include "IRPrinter.h"
10 #include "Scope.h"
11 #include "Target.h"
12 
13 namespace Halide {
14 
15 struct Argument;
16 class Module;
17 
18 namespace Internal {
19 
20 struct LoweredFunc;
21 
22 /** This class emits C++ code equivalent to a halide Stmt. It's
23  * mostly the same as an IRPrinter, but it's wrapped in a function
24  * definition, and some things are handled differently to be valid
25  * C++.
26  */
27 class CodeGen_C : public IRPrinter {
28 public:
29  enum OutputKind {
30  CHeader,
31  CPlusPlusHeader,
32  CImplementation,
33  CPlusPlusImplementation,
34  CExternDecl,
35  CPlusPlusExternDecl,
36  };
37 
38  /** Initialize a C code generator pointing at a particular output
39  * stream (e.g. a file, or std::cout) */
40  CodeGen_C(std::ostream &dest,
41  const Target &target,
42  OutputKind output_kind = CImplementation,
43  const std::string &include_guard = "");
44  ~CodeGen_C() override;
45 
46  /** Emit the declarations contained in the module as C code. */
47  void compile(const Module &module);
48 
49  /** The target we're generating code for */
50  const Target &get_target() const {
51  return target;
52  }
53 
54  static void test();
55 
56 protected:
57  enum class IntegerSuffixStyle {
58  PlainC = 0,
59  OpenCL = 1,
60  HLSL = 2
61  };
62 
63  /** How to emit 64-bit integer constants */
64  IntegerSuffixStyle integer_suffix_style = IntegerSuffixStyle::PlainC;
65 
66  /** Emit a declaration. */
67  // @{
68  virtual void compile(const LoweredFunc &func);
69  virtual void compile(const Buffer<> &buffer);
70  // @}
71 
72  /** An ID for the most recently generated ssa variable */
73  std::string id;
74 
75  /** The target being generated for. */
76  Target target;
77 
78  /** Controls whether this instance is generating declarations or
79  * definitions and whether the interface us extern "C" or C++. */
80  OutputKind output_kind;
81 
82  /** A cache of generated values in scope */
83  std::map<std::string, std::string> cache;
84 
85  /** Emit an expression as an assignment, then return the id of the
86  * resulting var */
87  std::string print_expr(const Expr &);
88 
89  /** Like print_expr, but cast the Expr to the given Type */
90  std::string print_cast_expr(const Type &, const Expr &);
91 
92  /** Emit a statement */
93  void print_stmt(const Stmt &);
94 
95  void create_assertion(const std::string &id_cond, const Expr &message);
96  void create_assertion(const Expr &cond, const Expr &message);
97 
98  enum AppendSpaceIfNeeded {
99  DoNotAppendSpace,
100  AppendSpace,
101  };
102 
103  /** Emit the C name for a halide type. If space_option is AppendSpace,
104  * and there should be a space between the type and the next token,
105  * one is appended. (This allows both "int foo" and "Foo *foo" to be
106  * formatted correctly. Otherwise the latter is "Foo * foo".)
107  */
108  virtual std::string print_type(Type, AppendSpaceIfNeeded space_option = DoNotAppendSpace);
109 
110  /** Emit a statement to reinterpret an expression as another type */
111  virtual std::string print_reinterpret(Type, const Expr &);
112 
113  /** Emit a version of a string that is a valid identifier in C (. is replaced with _) */
114  virtual std::string print_name(const std::string &);
115 
116  /** Add typedefs for vector types. Not needed for OpenCL, might
117  * use different syntax for other C-like languages. */
118  virtual void add_vector_typedefs(const std::set<Type> &vector_types);
119 
120  /** Bottleneck to allow customization of calls to generic Extern/PureExtern calls. */
121  virtual std::string print_extern_call(const Call *op);
122 
123  /** Convert a vector Expr into a series of scalar Exprs, then reassemble into vector of original type. */
124  std::string print_scalarized_expr(const Expr &e);
125 
126  /** Emit an SSA-style assignment, and set id to the freshly generated name. Return id. */
127  virtual std::string print_assignment(Type t, const std::string &rhs);
128 
129  /** Emit free for the heap allocation. **/
130  void print_heap_free(const std::string &alloc_name);
131 
132  /** Return true if only generating an interface, which may be extern "C" or C++ */
133  bool is_header() {
134  return output_kind == CHeader ||
135  output_kind == CPlusPlusHeader;
136  }
137 
138  /** Return true if only generating an interface, which may be extern "C" or C++ */
139  bool is_extern_decl() {
140  return output_kind == CExternDecl ||
141  output_kind == CPlusPlusExternDecl;
142  }
143 
144  /** Return true if only generating an interface, which may be extern "C" or C++ */
145  bool is_header_or_extern_decl() {
146  return is_header() || is_extern_decl();
147  }
148 
149  /** Return true if generating C++ linkage. */
150  bool is_c_plus_plus_interface() {
151  return output_kind == CPlusPlusHeader ||
152  output_kind == CPlusPlusImplementation ||
153  output_kind == CPlusPlusExternDecl;
154  }
155 
156  /** Open a new C scope (i.e. throw in a brace, increase the indent) */
157  void open_scope();
158 
159  /** Close a C scope (i.e. throw in an end brace, decrease the indent) */
160  void close_scope(const std::string &comment);
161 
162  struct Allocation {
163  Type type;
164  };
165 
166  /** Track the types of allocations to avoid unnecessary casts. */
167  Scope<Allocation> allocations;
168 
169  /** Track which allocations actually went on the heap. */
170  Scope<> heap_allocations;
171 
172  /** True if there is a void * __user_context parameter in the arguments. */
173  bool have_user_context;
174 
175  /** Track current calling convention scope. */
176  bool extern_c_open;
177 
178  /** True if at least one gpu-based for loop is used. */
179  bool uses_gpu_for_loops;
180 
181  /** Track which handle types have been forward-declared already. */
182  std::set<const halide_handle_cplusplus_type *> forward_declared;
183 
184  /** If the Type is a handle type, emit a forward-declaration for it
185  * if we haven't already. */
186  void forward_declare_type_if_needed(const Type &t);
187 
188  void set_name_mangling_mode(NameMangling mode);
189

237  void visit_binop(Type t, const Expr &a, const Expr &b, const char *op);
238  void visit_relop(Type t, const Expr &a, const Expr &b, const char *scalar_op, const char *vector_op);
239 
240  template<typename T>
241  static std::string with_sep(const std::vector<T> &v, const std::string &sep) {
242  std::ostringstream o;
243  for (size_t i = 0; i < v.size(); ++i) {
244  if (i > 0) {
245  o << sep;
246  }
247  o << v[i];
248  }
249  return o.str();
250  }
251 
252  template<typename T>
253  static std::string with_commas(const std::vector<T> &v) {
254  return with_sep<T>(v, ", ");
255  }
256 
257  /** Are we inside an atomic node that uses mutex locks?
258  This is used for detecting deadlocks from nested atomics. */
259  bool inside_atomic_mutex_node;
260 
261  /** Emit atomic store instructions? */
262  bool emit_atomic_stores;
263 
264  /** true if add_vector_typedefs() has been called. */
265  bool using_vector_typedefs;
266 };
267
